title.narrative: 2.4. DOCUMENTING GRAVE VIOLATIONS

description.narrative: 2.4 Increased multi-stakeholder capacity to document grave violations against children and to protect them from, and mitigate the impact of armed conflict., which contributes to Access To Justice, Child Protection And Emergencies, Child Protection Systems, Child Protection â€“ General, Justice For Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 2. Child Protection - Improved child protection systems for the prevention of and response to violence, abuse, exploitation and neglect

sector.narrative: Access to child-friendly police and justice sector services
Child Protection humanitarian AoR/humanitarian sector coordination
MRM - Child protection monitoring and reporting of grave violations in armed conflict (Security Council Resolutions 1612, 1882, 1888 and 1960)
Technical assistance - Prevention and response services for violence against children

description.narrative: Justice, Law and Order policy, planning and administration
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities emergency relief
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 2.4 Increased multi-stakeholder capacity to document grave violations against children and to protect them from, and mitigate theimpact of armed conflict.

description.narrative: Inputs provided in the 2016 Secretary General Children and Armed Conflict Report; three Global Horizontal Notes submitted to SRSG CAAC; 2,798 grave violations affecting at least 28,097 children were documented; East Jerusalem mapping of protection service providers completed and legal assistance provided to 495 children in East Jerusalem | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: Existence of mechanisms to monitor and report on grave violations against children

actual.value: 2017:Fully achieved: Majority of incidents captured through database: Jan – Sept 2017, 2,798 incidents were documented in the reporting period, affecting at least 28,097 children

title.narrative: Existence of sub-cluster mechanism for child protection in humanitarian action that meets CCC standards for coordination

actual.value: 2017:Fully achieved: Workings groups meet in Gaza and WB on 1) CAAC, 2) Child Protection and 3) Mental Health and Psychosocial support. All have approved TORs and operate according to UNICEF Core Commitments for Children
